answers.answer: Hi,The cause of your symptoms could be amongst – Diabetes , Peripheral artery disease , peripheral neuropathy , Peripheral nerve trauma or peripheral nerve compression . Please consult a neurologist for the investigations , diagnosis and management of the underlying cause .Hope this helps you . Take care and regards !

question: hi,doctor. I am a 23 year-old student with left localised scalp paresthesia for the past one week. I feel numb when i touch it for which the sensation is different from the right side. The scalp paresthesia happens worse when I press my left elbow on the table but never on the right side even i press my right elbow on the table. Am i having nerve compression symptom? what are the complications? is it necessary for me to seek any treatment? really thanks so much, doctor.
title: scalp paresthesia
